metadata.Title: CVE-2023-6932 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - high
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel's ipv4: igmp componentcan be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation.A race condition can be exploited to cause a timer be mistakenly registeredon a RCU read locked object which is freed by another thread.We recommend upgrading past commite2b706c691905fe78468c361aaabc719d0a496f1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-6932` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.3.0-18-generic - 5.4.0-171.189
linux-image-5.3.0-18-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-171.189
linux-image-unsigned-5.3.0-18-generic - 5.4.0-171.189
linux-image-unsigned-5.3.0-18-lowlatency - 5.4.0-171.189
linux-image-unsigned-5.3.0-18-snapdragon - 5.4.0-171.189
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in focal is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '5.4.0-171.189').
linux-hwe-5.8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-5.11').
